section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—
subsection.def: aircraft container (飛機貨櫃) means a container designed for loading on an aircraft;
Class 1 S1DG (S1第1類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 1 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 2 S2DG (S2第2類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 2 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 2.1 S2DG (S2第2.1類危險品) means Class 2.1 dangerous goods specified in Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;
Class 2.2 S2DG (S2第2.2類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 2.2 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 2.3 S2DG (S2第2.3類危險品) means Class 2.3 dangerous goods specified in Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;
Class 3 S2DG (S2第3類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 3 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 3A S2DG (S2第3A類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 3A dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 4 S2DG (S2第4類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 4 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 4.1 S2DG (S2第4.1類危險品) means Class 4.1 dangerous goods specified in Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;
Class 4.2 S2DG (S2第4.2類危險品) means Class 4.2 dangerous goods specified in Schedule 2 to Cap.295E;
Class 4.3 S2DG (S2第4.3類危險品) means Class 4.3 dangerous goods specified in Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;
Class 5 S2DG (S2第5類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 5 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 5.1 S2DG (S2第5.1類危險品) means Class 5.1 dangerous goods specified in Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;
Class 5.2 S2DG (S2第5.2類危險品) means Class 5.2 dangerous goods specified in Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;
Class 6.1 S2DG (S2第6.1類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 6.1 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 8 S2DG (S2第8類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 8 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 9 S2DG (S2第9類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 9 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
Class 9A S3DG (S3第9A類危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Class 9A dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
*commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which this Regulation comes into operation;
Commissioner means the Commissioner of Mines;
designated blasting area (指定爆破區) means an area within a licensed blasting site where firing of S1DG may take place;
designated possession area (指定管有區) means an area within a licensed blasting site where S1DG used for blasting may be possessed as mentioned in section 51;
DG (危險品) means—(a)S1DG;(b)S2DG; or(c)Class 9A S3DG;
Director means the Director of Fire Services;
Group 8 S1DG (S1第8組危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of Group 8 explosives by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
handling (處理), in relation to DG, includes all operations connected with loading, unloading, discharging, stacking, stowing or restowing of any DG and handle (處理) is to be construed accordingly;
motor vehicle (汽車) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374);
premises (處所) means any premises (whether or not an open space), and includes a building and a tank;
receptacle (容器) means a container for receiving and holding S1DG or S2DG, including any parts for closing the container;
repealed Cap. 295B (《已廢除第295B章》) means the Dangerous Goods (General) Regulations (Cap. 295 sub. leg. B) as in force immediately before the commencement date;
S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) (S2危險品(第2/3/3A類)) means Class 2 S2DG, Class 3 S2DG or Class 3A S2DG;
Secretary means the Secretary for Culture, Sports and Tourism; (L.N. 144 of 2022)
subsidiary hazard (次要危險性), in relation to each type of S2DG, means the subsidiary hazard (if any) specified in column 4 of the table in Part 2, 3 or 4 of Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E opposite to the type;
tank (貯槽) means a static tank or a reservoir used to contain S2DG;
working day (工作日) means a day that is neither a Saturday nor a public holiday.

subsection.content: In this Regulation, a reference to a Class (including a special Class), Division, UN number, HK number, Group (including group) or packing group in relation to any DG is a reference to the classification or identification of the dangerous goods specified in Schedule 1, 2 or 3 to Cap. 295E.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 2
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: authorized shot firer (獲授權引爆手) means a person who—(a)is the holder of a mine blasting certificate issued or renewed under regulation 22 of the Mines (Safety) Regulations (Cap. 285 sub. leg. B); or(b)is the licensee of a use (individual) licence;
blasting (爆破) means the breaking of rocks for excavation, or the demolition of any building or structure, by the use of S1DG;
blasting site (爆破地盤) means a construction site or a quarry where blasting is carried out;
compatibility group (配裝組) means a compatibility group specified in section 4 of Schedule 1 to Cap. 295E;
construction site (建築地盤) has the meaning given by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
conveyance permit (運送許可證) means a permit granted under section 82;

designated conveyance area (指定運送區) means an area outside a licensed store incidental to the use of Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG in which a conveyance permit for conveying the S1DG is not required;
designated evacuation area (指定疏散區) means an area within a licensed blasting site the access to which is not permitted under section 65;
detonator (雷管) includes a substance or device manufactured or used for initiating any S1DG by means of detonation;
discharge (blasting) permit (燃爆(爆破)許可證) means a permit granted or renewed under section 52;
discharge (fireworks) permit (燃放(爆竹煙花)許可證) means a permit granted or renewed under section 73;
explosive article (爆炸物品) means an article falling within paragraph (b) of the definition of explosive in section 2 of the Ordinance;

explosive combination (爆炸品組合) means—(a)2 or more explosive articles;(b)2 or more explosive substances; or(c)one or more explosive articles and one or more explosive substances,combined in the same S1DG packaging of the same Division and compatibility group;
explosive content (爆炸品含量) has the meaning given by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
explosive substance (爆炸物質) means a substance or mixture falling within paragraph (a) of the definition of explosive in section 2 of the Ordinance;
factory (工廠) means any premises consisting of at least one S1DG process building;
firework (爆竹煙花) has the meaning given to “Group 7 (firework)” by section 2 of Schedule 1 to Cap. 295E;
Group 2 S1DG (S1第2組危險品) means any explosives belonging to Group 2 specified in section 2 of Schedule 1 to Cap. 295E;
Group 5 S1DG (S1第5組危險品) means any explosives belonging to Group 5 specified in section 2 of Schedule 1 to Cap. 295E;
intact special Class 9 S1DG (原封S1第9類特殊危險品) means special Class 9 S1DG that are intact in their original S1DG packaging that complies with the IMDG Code;

licensed blasting site (持牌爆破地盤) means—(a)in relation to a manufacture (blasting) licence—a blasting site in which the manufacture of Group 2 S1DG is permitted under the licence; or(b)in relation to a blasting permission as defined by section 48—a blasting site in which the carrying out of blasting operation is permitted under the permission;
licensed factory (持牌工廠) means a factory in which the manufacture of S1DG is permitted under a manufacture (factory) licence;
licensed Mode A store (持牌甲類貯存所) means a Mode A store the use of which for the storage of S1DG is permitted under section 22(1)(a)(i);
licensed Mode B store (持牌乙類貯存所) means a Mode B store the use of which for the storage of Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG is permitted under section 22(1)(a)(ii);
licensed store (持牌貯存所) means—(a)in relation to a Mode A licence—the licensed Mode A store under the licence; or(b)in relation to a Mode B licence—the licensed Mode B store under the licence;
manufacture (blasting) licence (製造(爆破)牌照) means a licence granted or renewed under section 16;
manufacture (factory) licence (製造(工廠)牌照) means a licence granted or renewed under section 5;
manufactured fireworks (爆竹煙花製品) has the meaning given to “Group 7 (firework)” by section 2 of Schedule 1 to Cap. 295E;
Mode A licence (甲類牌照) means a store and use licence granted or renewed under section 22 in relation to storage in a Mode A store;
Mode A store (甲類貯存所) means a premises consisting of a single storey stand-alone structure;
Mode B licence (乙類牌照) means a store and use licence granted or renewed under section 22 in relation to storage in a Mode B store;
Mode B store (乙類貯存所) means a premises consisting of a room or a fireproof container fixed in a compartment;

owner (擁有人), in relation to a vehicle, means—(a)the person in whose name the vehicle is registered under the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374);(b)the person by whom the vehicle is kept and used; or(c)if the vehicle is the subject of a hiring agreement or hire purchase agreement—the person who has possession of the vehicle under the agreement;
possession licence (管有牌照) means a licence granted or renewed under section 49;
quarry (石礦場) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Pneumoconiosis and Mesothelioma (Compensation) Ordinance (Cap. 360);
S1DG package (S1危險品包裹), in relation to S1DG, means—(a)S1DG packaging; and(b)any explosive article, explosive substance or explosive combination contained within the S1DG packaging;

S1DG packaging (S1危險品包裝) means any receptacle containing S1DG and any other component or material necessary for the receptacle to perform its containment or safety function, but does not include—(a)an envelope, case or contrivance forming part of an explosive article; or(b)any freight container, aircraft container, pallet or vehicle;

S1DG process building (S1危險品工序建築物) means a single storey stand-alone structure in which there is kept or is present, or in which there is likely to be kept or to be present, in the course of the manufacture of S1DG, any explosive or any ingredient of such explosive which—(a)has explosive properties by itself; or(b)when mixed with any other ingredient or article kept or present in the structure, is capable of forming an explosive mixture or compound;
security guard (保安護衞員) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Firearms and Ammunition Ordinance (Cap. 238);
store and use licence (貯存暨使用牌照) means a Mode A licence or a Mode B licence;
use (使用), in relation to S1DG the use of which is permitted under a store and use licence or a use (individual) licence, means to prepare, fire or destroy the S1DG;
use (individual) licence (使用(個人)牌照) means a licence granted or renewed under section 45.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application of Part 2

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Part applies to S1DG on land and at sea.

subsection.leadIn: This Part does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any S1DG carried on board a vessel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the discharge of fireworks at sea.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Grant and renewal of manufacture (factory) licence
section.content: The Commissioner may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a licence mentioned in section 6 of the Ordinance permitting the manufacture of S1DG in a factory.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Form of manufacture (factory) licence

subsection.content: A manufacture (factory) licence must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 7; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and other particulars of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of S1DG permitted to be manufactured;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the address of the licensed factory;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other information the Commissioner thinks fit, including the licence’s date of issue and validity period.

subsection.content: The licence must be authenticated by the Commissioner.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Conditions of manufacture (factory) licence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Commissioner may endorse on a manufacture (factory) licence any conditions for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: safety of the licensed factory;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: operation, management and security of the factory, including—

subparagraph.content: the number of employees, security guards and visitors; and
the supervisors of an S1DG process building;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: manufacturing operation and maintenance of the factory;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: records of S1DG manufactured in the factory;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: handling, conveyance, storage or disposal of an explosive (whether or not falling within the definition of S1DG) during the manufacturing process;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: quantity of explosives (whether or not falling within the definition of S1DG) that—

subparagraph.content: may be stored in the factory without a store and use licence; and
is reasonably required for, and incidental to, the manufacture of S1DG permitted to be manufactured under the licence;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: locations of the S1DG process buildings of the factory;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: kind or quantity of S1DG that may be manufactured in the S1DG process buildings of the factory.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Restriction on alteration etc. to licensed factory

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a manufacture (factory) licence must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except with the approval of the Commissioner, no material alteration is made to the licensed factory (including any fittings or equipment in it); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all parts of the licensed factory (including any fittings or equipment in it) are maintained in good repair in compliance with the conditions endorsed on the licence under section 7(c).

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Match, lighter, etc. prohibited in licensed factory

subsection.content: A person present in a licensed factory must not carry any match, cigarette lighter or any other article that is capable of producing a spark or flame.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Security guards on duty in licensed factory

subsection.content: Subject to section 11, the licensee of a manufacture (factory) licence must ensure that the number of security guards (including armed security guards if required by the Commissioner) on duty at the licensed factory is at all times not less than the number specified in the condition endorsed on the licence under section 7(b)(i).
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Restriction on number of persons present in S1DG process building

subsection.content: Except with the approval of the Commissioner, the licensee of a manufacture (factory) licence must ensure that the number of persons present in an S1DG process building of the licensed factory does not exceed the number specified in the condition endorsed on the licence under section 7(b)(i).
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Supervisor of S1DG process building

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a manufacture (factory) licence must ensure that, while the manufacture operation of S1DG (including the handling, conveyance, storage or disposal of an explosive) is carried out in an S1DG process building of the licensed factory, there is present in the building—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if 20 or less persons are on duty in the building—at least one supervisor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if more than 20 persons are on duty in the building—at least one supervisor for every 20 persons or part of 20 persons on duty.

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 months.
For subsection (1), a supervisor is a person described in the condition endorsed on the manufacture (factory) licence under section 7(b)(ii).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Persons on duty in S1DG process building to wear certain clothing and footwear

subsection.content: The licensee of a manufacture (factory) licence must ensure that a person who is on duty in an S1DG process building of the licensed factory wears only the clothing and footwear approved by the Commissioner.
The licensee must ensure that changing rooms are, if required by the Commissioner, provided in the licensed factory.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Smoking, carrying lighted cigarette, etc. prohibited in S1DG process building

subsection.content: A person must not smoke, carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe or use an article that is capable of producing a spark or flame, in an S1DG process building of a licensed factory.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Only tools made of certain materials may be used in S1DG process building

subsection.content: The licensee of a manufacture (factory) licence must ensure that only a tool made of non-ferrous metal, wood or any other material approved by the Commissioner is used in an S1DG process building of the licensed factory.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: wood (木) includes plywood.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Grant and renewal of manufacture (blasting) licence
section.content: The Commissioner may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a licence mentioned in section 6 of the Ordinance permitting the manufacture of Group 2 S1DG in one or more blasting sites.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Form of manufacture (blasting) licence

subsection.content: A manufacture (blasting) licence must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 18; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and other particulars of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of Group 2 S1DG permitted to be manufactured;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the details of the equipment to be used in the manufacturing process, including the name and serial number;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other information the Commissioner thinks fit, including the licence’s date of issue and validity period.

subsection.content: The licence must be authenticated by the Commissioner.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Conditions of manufacture (blasting) licence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Commissioner may endorse on a manufacture (blasting) licence any conditions for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all licensed blasting sites where Group 2 S1DG are to be manufactured;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: person who undertakes the manufacturing operation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: manufacturing operation and maintenance of the equipment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: handling or disposal of the Group 2 S1DG manufactured in the blasting sites;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: records of the Group 2 S1DG manufactured in the blasting sites.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Maintenance of equipment

subsection.content: The licensee of a manufacture (blasting) licence must ensure that the equipment used in the manufacturing process at the licensed blasting sites are maintained in good repair in compliance with the conditions endorsed on the licence under section 18(c).
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Control of manufacturing process

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a manufacture (blasting) licence must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a manufacturing process is only undertaken by the person described in the condition endorsed on the licence under section 18(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: immediately after the completion of the manufacturing process—

subparagraph.content: all Group 2 S1DG manufactured are loaded directly into blast holes for use without undue delay; and
any Group 2 S1DG manufactured but not used in the licensed blasting site are desensitized and properly disposed of; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: records of the kind and quantity of Group 2 S1DG manufactured at any one time are maintained.

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Storage of S1DG

subsection.leadIn: S1DG (except Group 5 S1DG and Group 8 S1DG) must be stored in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Government Explosives Depot; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed store.

subsection.content: Group 5 S1DG must only be stored in a Government Explosives Depot.
A person who stores S1DG in contravention of subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Government Explosives Depot (政府爆炸品倉庫) means a depot designated as a Government Explosives Depot under section 13A of the Ordinance.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Grant and renewal of store and use licence

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a licence mentioned in section 6 of the Ordinance permitting the licensee to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: store—

subparagraph.content: in a Mode A store, S1DG (except Group 5 S1DG and Group 8 S1DG); or

subparagraph.leadIn: in a Mode B store, Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that are not used for blasting; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the quantity of which does not exceed the storage limit under section 41;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG otherwise than in the Mode A store or Mode B store (as may be appropriate); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: so store S1DG and use them.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(b), the reference to use does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: blasting in a licensed blasting site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fireworks display mentioned in section 72.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Form of store and use licence

subsection.content: A store and use licence must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 24; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and other particulars of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of S1DG permitted to be stored;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the address of the licensed store;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the locations at which Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG may be used (if applicable);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the quantity of Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG that may be used at any one time (if applicable);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any other information the Commissioner thinks fit, including the licence’s date of issue and validity period.

subsection.content: The licence must be authenticated by the Commissioner.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Conditions of store and use licence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Commissioner may endorse on a store and use licence any conditions for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: safety or security of storage of S1DG, including the handling of the S1DG in the licensed store;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: person who is responsible for managing the store;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: firefighting measures relating to the store;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: stock register of the store mentioned in section 30;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: disposal of deteriorated, damaged, expired or surplus S1DG from the store;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a description of the designated conveyance area;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: method of using Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: protective and precautionary measures for using Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG;
persons permitted to use Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Licensee to comply with direction

subsection.content: The Commissioner may give a direction to the licensee of a store and use licence as to the manner in which the S1DG are to be stored.
The licensee must comply with a direction given under subsection (1).
A licensee who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Licensee to take precautions

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a store and use licence must take all reasonable precautions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to prevent fire or explosion in the licensed store; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the S1DG kept in the store may become dangerous by interaction with water—to exclude water from the store.

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Restriction of storage in licensed store

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a store and use licence must ensure that only the following are stored in the licensed store—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the S1DG specified in the licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: non-ferrous container, receptacle, tool or instrument that is used directly in connection with the storage of the S1DG; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any other articles that—

subparagraph.content: are not hazardous to the S1DG stored in the store; and
are approved by the Commissioner for storage in the store.

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Licensee responsible for deteriorated or damaged S1DG

subsection.content: The licensee of a store and use licence must ensure that the S1DG kept in the licensed store are inspected at least once a month by a person described in the condition endorsed on the licence under section 24(b) as the person who is responsible for managing the store.

subsection.leadIn: If any deteriorated or damaged S1DG are discovered in the licensed store, the licensee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: report the fact to the Commissioner immediately; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remove the deteriorated or damaged S1DG from the licensed store and destroy them as soon as reasonably practicable in the manner specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Licensee to inspect conveyance permit etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the licensee of a store and use licence must ensure that no person removes any S1DG from the licensed store unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: before the S1DG are removed, the person has produced, and the licensee (or the licensee’s employee or agent) has inspected, the following document—

subparagraph.content: a conveyance permit permitting the conveyance of the S1DG; or

if the S1DG are cartridges for small arms or safety cartridges—a licence granted under section 30(1) of the Firearms and Ammunition Ordinance (Cap. 238) (Cap. 238 licence) allowing the removal or conveyance of those cartridges by the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensee (or the licensee’s employee or agent) signs on the conveyance permit or the Cap. 238 licence to confirm that the permit or licence has been so inspected before the S1DG are removed from the licensed store.

subsection.content: Subsections (1)(a)(i) and (1)(b) do not apply to S1DG that are exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance for conveyance under this Part or Division 1 of Part 3 of Cap. 295E.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Licensee to maintain stock register

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a store and use licence must maintain a stock register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: containing—

subparagraph.content: the kind and quantity of the S1DG stored in the licensed store, and the dates on which the S1DG are brought into the store;
information on the invoice or any other document relating to the source from which the S1DG are obtained; and
records of removal of the S1DG from the store; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: kept in a way that the balance in the store of each kind of the S1DG can readily be recognized from the register.

subsection.leadIn: The licensee must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the stock register is kept—

subparagraph.content: up to date;
in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner; and
in the licensed store or at a place close to the store; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each entry in the stock register is signed by a person described in the condition endorsed on the licence under section 24(b) as the person who is responsible for managing the store.

subsection.leadIn: The licensee must, on request by the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce the stock register for inspection by the Commissioner at the time and place specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the Commissioner to make copies of the stock register.

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Restriction on storage of different S1DG

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the licensee of a store and use licence must not store, or cause or permit to be stored, S1DG of different classes or different compatibility groups in the licensed store.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to the storage in the same licensed store of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Class 1 S1DG of a compatibility group other than group A, K or L together with other Class 1 S1DG of compatibility group S (other than detonators) and intact special Class 9 S1DG;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: Class 1 S1DG of compatibility group C, D or E together with other Class 1 S1DG of—

subparagraph.content: compatibility group C, D or E; or

compatibility group G (other than firework) of Division 1.3 or 1.4 (group G S1DG) that is in the form of explosive article, on condition that the group G S1DG is not liable to give rise to loose powder;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Class 1 S1DG that is a detonator of compatibility group B together with other detonators of compatibility group S; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to section 39, Class 1 S1DG that is a detonator of compatibility group B or S together with other Class 1 S1DG of compatibility group D that are to be used for blasting.

subsection.content: Except with the approval of the Commissioner, the licensee of a store and use licence must not store, or cause or permit to be stored, Group 8 S1DG together with any other S1DG in the licensed store.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Security of licensed Mode A store

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a Mode A licence must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensed Mode A store is protected by a fence in the manner specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except with the approval of the Commissioner, the store is securely locked after sunset and before sunrise;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every entrance to the store (including any gate of the fence mentioned in paragraph (a)) is at all times securely locked, except when the entrance is required to be unlocked for inspection, maintenance or handling of S1DG in the store;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no person may enter the store unless the person is authorized by the licensee or the Commissioner to do so; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the number of security guards (including armed security guards if required by the Commissioner) on duty at the store is at all times not less than the number specified in the condition endorsed on the licence under section 24(a).

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Licensed Mode A store kept clean

subsection.content: The licensee of a Mode A licence must ensure that the interior of the licensed Mode A store is kept clean and free from any grit or dirt that is capable of producing a spark or flame.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Ground surrounding licensed Mode A store kept clear

subsection.content: The licensee of a Mode A licence must ensure that the ground surrounding the licensed Mode A store to the distance as required by the condition endorsed on the licence under section 24(a) is kept clear of all obstructions.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: obstructions (障礙物) includes any vegetation.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Licensed Mode A store provided with lightning conductor

subsection.content: The licensee of a Mode A licence must ensure that the licensed Mode A store is, if required by the Commissioner, provided with an efficient lightning conductor.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Repair work in or to licensed Mode A store

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a Mode A licence must ensure that no repair work is carried out in or to the licensed Mode A store unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all S1DG have been removed from the store; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the store has been thoroughly washed out and cleaned.

subsection.content: The licensee must ensure that no tool or instrument made of ferrous metal is used in any repair work in the store until subsections (1)(a) and (1)(b) have been complied with.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Smoking, carrying lighted cigarette, etc. prohibited in or near licensed Mode A store

subsection.leadIn: A person must not smoke, carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe or use an article that is capable of producing a spark or flame in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all areas of a licensed Mode A store; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all areas within the fence of the store mentioned in section 32(1)(a).

subsection.content: The licensee of a Mode A licence must take all reasonable precautions to ensure that subsection (1) is not contravened in relation to the licensed Mode A store.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Warning sign, placard, etc. outside licensed Mode A store

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a Mode A licence must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a warning sign that complies with subsection (2) is displayed outside or adjacent to every entrance to the licensed Mode A store;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a notice in English and Chinese is displayed at a conspicuous place outside or adjacent to—

subparagraph.content: every entrance to the store; and
every gate of the fence of the store mentioned in section 32(1)(a),

paragraph.continued: to the effect that smoking, carrying a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe or using an article that is capable of producing a spark or flame is prohibited in the areas specified in section 37(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), a placard that conforms to the following is displayed at a conspicuous place outside or adjacent to every entrance to the store—

subparagraph.leadIn: the form in the following Figure in Part 1 of Schedule 1—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3—Figure No. 1;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.4—Figure No. 2;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: for special Class 9 S1DG that are mentioned in section 11 of that Schedule—Figure No. 2;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.5—Figure No. 3;

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.6—Figure No. 4; and
the specifications specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the warning sign must legibly show the English words “DANGER—EXPLOSIVES” and the Chinese characters “危險—爆炸品” in white against a background in red; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the English words and Chinese characters must not be less than 100 mm in height.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(c) does not apply to a licensed Mode A store that is used solely for storing intact special Class 9 S1DG.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Storage of detonators in licensed Mode A store

subsection.content: The licensee of a Mode A licence must ensure that detonators are not stored in the licensed Mode A store together with any other S1DG unless they are segregated in compliance with subsection (2).
Detonators must be segregated from other S1DG in a manner that can effectively prevent an explosion or fire that occurs in the storage area for detonators from initiating other S1DG in the store.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Security of licensed Mode B store

subsection.leadIn: Except with the approval of the Commissioner, the licensee of a Mode B licence must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the licensed Mode B store is a room—the room is securely locked; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the store is a fireproof container fixed in a compartment—both the container and compartment are securely locked.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to the unlocking of a licensed Mode B store for inspection, maintenance or handling of S1DG in the store.
The licensee of a Mode B licence must take all reasonable precautions to prevent any person from unlocking the store unless the person is authorized by the licensee or the Commissioner to do so.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Storage limit of licensed Mode B store

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a Mode B licence must ensure that the quantity of S1DG in the licensed Mode B store that are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a Group or Class set out in column 2 in section 2 of Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of a Division (if applicable) set out in column 3 in section 2 of Schedule 2,

subsection.continued: does not exceed the storage limit specified opposite to that Group or Class and Division (if applicable) in column 4 in section 2 of Schedule 2.

subsection.content: A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Smoking, carrying lighted cigarette, etc. prohibited in or near licensed Mode B store

subsection.content: A person must not smoke, carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe or use an article that is capable of producing a spark or flame in a licensed Mode B store.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not smoke, carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe or use an article that is capable of producing a spark or flame—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the licensed Mode B store is open—within 6 metres of the store, unless the area where the act of smoking, carrying or using occurs is separated from the store by a fire resisting wall, floor or ceiling; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the licensed Mode B store is a fireproof container fixed in a compartment—in the compartment.

subsection.content: The licensee of a Mode B licence must take all reasonable precautions to ensure that subsections (1) and (2) are not contravened in relation to the licensed Mode B store.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Warning sign, placard, etc. outside licensed Mode B store

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a Mode B licence must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a warning sign that complies with subsection (2) is displayed outside or adjacent to every entrance to the licensed Mode B store;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a notice in English and Chinese is displayed at a conspicuous place outside or adjacent to—

subparagraph.content: every entrance to the store; and
if the store is a fireproof container fixed in a compartment—the compartment,

paragraph.continued: to the effect that smoking, carrying a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe or using an article that is capable of producing a spark or flame is prohibited in the areas specified in section 42(1) or (2); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), a placard that conforms to the following is displayed at a conspicuous place outside or adjacent to every entrance to the store—

subparagraph.leadIn: the form in the following Figure in Part 1 of Schedule 1—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3—Figure No. 1;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.4—Figure No. 2;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: for special Class 9 S1DG that are mentioned in section 11 of that Schedule—Figure No. 2;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.5—Figure No. 3;

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.6—Figure No. 4; and
the specifications specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the warning sign must legibly show the English words “DANGER—EXPLOSIVES” and the Chinese characters “危險—爆炸品” in white against a background in red; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the English words and Chinese characters must not be less than 40 mm in height.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(c) does not apply to a licensed Mode B store that is used solely for storing intact special Class 9 S1DG.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Use of S1DG

subsection.leadIn: A person must not cause or permit any individual to use any quantity of S1DG at any location unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for all S1DG, the individual—

subparagraph.content: is the licensee of a use (individual) licence; and
is permitted under the licence to use that quantity of S1DG at the location; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without affecting paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.content: for Group 6 S1DG, Group 7 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG that was stored in a licensed store—the individual is a person specified in the condition endorsed on the store and use licence under section 24(i) as a person permitted to use the S1DG; or
for S1DG used in a licensed blasting site—the individual is the holder of a mine blasting certificate issued or renewed under regulation 22 of the Mines (Safety) Regulations (Cap. 285 sub. leg. B).

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Grant and renewal of use (individual) licence
section.content: The Commissioner may, on application by an individual and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a licence mentioned in section 6 of the Ordinance permitting the individual to use S1DG.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Form of use (individual) licence

subsection.content: A use (individual) licence must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 47; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and other particulars of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the detailed description of the use of S1DG;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of S1DG permitted to be used;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the locations at which S1DG may be used;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any other information the Commissioner thinks fit, including the licence’s date of issue and validity period.

subsection.content: The licence must be authenticated by the Commissioner.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Conditions of use (individual) licence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Commissioner may endorse on a use (individual) licence any conditions for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: method of using S1DG;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: safe handling of S1DG;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: responsibility for, and supervision of, the use of S1DG.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Interpretation of Subdivision 1 of Division 4 of Part 2
section.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
section.def: blasting permission (爆破准許) means—(a)in relation to a blasting operation in which S1DG are used for blasting—subject to paragraph (b), a possession licence together with a discharge (blasting) permit; or(b)in relation to a blasting operation in which only Group 8 S1DG are used—a discharge (blasting) permit.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Grant and renewal of possession licence

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a licence mentioned in section 6 of the Ordinance permitting the licensee to possess S1DG (other than Group 8 S1DG) in a blasting site.
A possession licence may only be granted together with a discharge (blasting) permit for the use of the S1DG in the blasting site.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Form of possession licence

subsection.content: A possession licence must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 51; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and other particulars of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of S1DG permitted to be possessed;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the address of the licensed blasting site;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other information the Commissioner thinks fit, including the licence’s date of issue and validity period.

subsection.content: The licence must be authenticated by the Commissioner.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Conditions of possession licence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Commissioner may endorse on a possession licence any conditions for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: extent of the designated possession area where S1DG used for blasting may be possessed only if the S1DG are to be used in the blasting site without undue delay;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: safety or security for possessing the S1DG, including the handling of the S1DG within the designated possession area;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: person who is responsible for handling the possession and conveyance of the S1DG in the blasting site;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: vehicle (if any) for the conveyance of the S1DG within the designated possession area;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: disposal of deteriorated, damaged or surplus S1DG within the designated possession area;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: records on the possession of the S1DG.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Grant and renewal of discharge (blasting) permit

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a permit permitting the discharge of S1DG in a blasting site.
For the purposes of section 6 of the Ordinance, a discharge (blasting) permit is regarded as a licence granted under the Ordinance.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Form of discharge (blasting) permit

subsection.content: A discharge (blasting) permit must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 54; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The permit must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the permit number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and other particulars of the permit holder;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the permit;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of S1DG permitted to be discharged;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the address of the licensed blasting site;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other information the Commissioner thinks fit, including the permit’s date of issue and validity period.

subsection.content: The permit must be authenticated by the Commissioner.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Conditions of discharge (blasting) permit
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Commissioner may endorse on a discharge (blasting) permit any conditions for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: extent of the designated blasting area;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: extent of the designated evacuation area;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: protective and precautionary measures for blasting operations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: safe handling of S1DG;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: method of discharge, including the maximum quantity of S1DG that may at any one time be loaded into each blast hole;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: particulars of authorized shot firers employed or engaged for conducting blasting operations in the licensed blasting site;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: monitoring and record keeping of blasting operations;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: handling of misfire.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Authorized shot firer required for blasting

subsection.content: The permit holder of a discharge (blasting) permit must employ or engage at least one authorized shot firer described in the condition endorsed on the permit under section 54(f) for conducting blasting operations in the licensed blasting site.
A permit holder who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Smoking, carrying lighted cigarette, etc. prohibited while S1DG are being prepared etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not smoke, or carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe, in any licensed blasting site while S1DG are being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: removed from a licensed store (if applicable) within the site;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prepared, loaded or connected for blasting; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: laid at the site.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Person engaged in preparing etc. S1DG not to carry article capable of producing spark or flame

subsection.content: A person who is engaged in preparing, loading or connecting S1DG in a licensed blasting site must not carry an article that is capable of producing a spark or flame.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an article that is required by an authorized shot firer for the purpose of initiating S1DG.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Conveyance of S1DG in licensed blasting site

subsection.content: A person must not convey, or cause or permit to be conveyed, S1DG in a licensed blasting site unless the conveyance is under the personal supervision of an authorized shot firer.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: detonators are not carried in the same container with other S1DG when the detonators are conveyed in the site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the detonators are conveyed on a vehicle in the site—a placard that conforms to the following is displayed at a conspicuous place on the vehicle—

subparagraph.leadIn: the form in the following Figure in Part 1 of Schedule 1—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3—Figure No. 1;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.4—Figure No. 2;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: for special Class 9 S1DG that are mentioned in section 11 of that Schedule—Figure No. 2;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.5—Figure No. 3;

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.6—Figure No. 4; and
the specifications specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.
An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Preparing S1DG for blasting

subsection.leadIn: An authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site must ensure that when S1DG are prepared for blasting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instructions provided by the manufacturer of the S1DG that are not inconsistent with this Part are complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions endorsed on the discharge (blasting) permit are complied with.

subsection.content: An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Loading S1DG for blasting

subsection.leadIn: An authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site must ensure that when S1DG are loaded for blasting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instructions provided by the manufacturer of the S1DG that are not inconsistent with this Part are complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the S1DG are loaded by—

subparagraph.content: the authorized shot firer; or
a person who works under the shot firer’s direction and supervision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the conditions endorsed on the discharge (blasting) permit are complied with.

subsection.content: An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Means of blasting

subsection.leadIn: An authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the blasting is carried out by loading S1DG into blast holes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except with the approval of the Commissioner, S1DG are not used on ground surface.

subsection.content: An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Loading quantity for blasting

subsection.content: An authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site must ensure that each blast hole is loaded with a quantity of S1DG not exceeding the maximum quantity described in the condition endorsed on the discharge (blasting) permit under section 54(e).
An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Precautions for blasting

subsection.content: Each person specified in subsection (2) must ensure that, during a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site, S1DG must not be fired unless effective and adequate precautions have been taken to prevent any fragments from being projected in a dangerous way.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the permit holder of the discharge (blasting) permit for the licensed blasting site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each authorized shot firer who conducts the blasting operation in the site.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Warning signal and sign for blasting

subsection.leadIn: Each person specified in subsection (2) must ensure that, for the period of not less than 5 minutes before a blasting starts in a licensed blasting site until S1DG have been fired, there is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a continuous audible warning signal at the site with sufficient strength to alert persons with ordinary hearing in, or in the vicinity of, the site (including persons in any vehicle in or approaching the site); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a continuous display of a red flag and other appropriate warning sign at each point of access to the designated evacuation area mentioned in section 54(b) to ensure that persons are warned of the danger a person in the area may be exposed to.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the permit holder of the discharge (blasting) permit for the licensed blasting site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each authorized shot firer who conducts the blasting operation in the site.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s65
section.heading: No entry to designated evacuation area while warning signal or sign sounded or displayed

subsection.leadIn: While the warning signal or sign mentioned in section 64(1) is sounded or displayed, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not enter the designated evacuation area mentioned in section 54(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is in the area—must not refuse to leave it after being requested to leave by—

subparagraph.content: a public officer; or
a person who is employed or engaged by the permit holder of the discharge (blasting) permit.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to a person authorized by the Commissioner to conduct, supervise or inspect the blasting operation.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Use of detonating fuse for firing not allowed

subsection.content: Except with the approval of the Commissioner, an authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site must ensure that no detonating fuse is used for firing.
An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: fuse (信管) includes a substance or device manufactured or used for initiating any S1DG by means of burning.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Use of exploders for firing

subsection.leadIn: An authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site by using an exploder for firing S1DG must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exploder, or a detachable device removed from the exploder the removal of which renders the exploder inoperable in firing S1DG, is under his or her control when the S1DG are prepared, loaded or connected;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an electric exploder is used—the S1DG must not be fired unless the shot firer has tested the circuit for continuity and resistance with a circuit tester that is maintained according to the instructions provided by the manufacturer of the exploder that are not inconsistent with this Part; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the conditions endorsed on the discharge (blasting) permit are complied with.

subsection.content: An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: electric exploder (電爆炸裝置) includes any electronic device that is used to initiate a detonator.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Action taken immediately after firing

subsection.content: An authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site must, as soon as reasonably practicable after S1DG are fired, confirm whether the S1DG have been completely fired.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 70, an authorized shot firer must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no unexploded S1DG remains in the licensed blasting site when he or she leaves the site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except with the approval of the Commissioner, any S1DG that are not used or destroyed in the operation are returned to the licensed store from which the S1DG were removed for use in the operation.

subsection.content: An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Record of blasting operations

subsection.leadIn: An authorized shot firer must maintain a record of every blasting operation conducted by him or her in a licensed blasting site containing the details of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the blast holes bored in the operation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the depth of each blast hole;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of S1DG loaded into each blast hole;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the time of firing; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: misfire, if any, and how the misfire is dealt with.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized shot firer must ensure that the record mentioned in subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the form specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the information mentioned in subsection (1)(a), (b) and (c)—compiled when the S1DG are loaded; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: completed as soon as reasonably practicable after the blasting operation has been conducted.

subsection.content: An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Misfire

subsection.leadIn: If, during a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site, any S1DG fail to detonate after firing, each person specified in subsection (2) must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the place where the firing took place is searched to locate any unexploded S1DG;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the misfired S1DG are dealt with—

subparagraph.content: in the manner described in the condition endorsed on the discharge (blasting) permit under section 54(h); or
in any other manner as the Commissioner may direct; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no person (other than a person whom the shot firer considers necessary for handling the misfired S1DG) comes closer than 15 metres from the place where the firing took place until the misfired S1DG have been fired, rendered safe or otherwise dealt with.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the permit holder of the discharge (blasting) permit for the licensed blasting site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each authorized shot firer who conducts the blasting operation in the site.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Special precautions for blasting

subsection.content: If an authorized shot firer who conducts a blasting operation in a licensed blasting site under a discharge (blasting) permit considers that any special precautions are reasonably necessary for the safety of any person or property in the vicinity of the site, the shot firer must notify the permit holder of the precautions.
Except with the approval of the Commissioner, a person must not conduct any blasting operation until the precautions mentioned in subsection (1) have been taken.
An authorized shot firer who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.
A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Discharge of manufactured fireworks for fireworks display on land

subsection.leadIn: A person must not discharge any fireworks, or cause or permit any fireworks to be discharged, for the production of any pyrotechnic effect for fireworks display on land unless they are manufactured fireworks discharged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under a discharge (fireworks) permit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in compliance with a permission granted under subsection (2).

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, grant a general permission for the discharge of manufactured fireworks by the public or a specified class of the public subject to the conditions specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may grant a general permission under subsection (2) after taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the interests of public safety;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether it is more appropriate to grant a discharge (fireworks) permit under section 73(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether it is reasonable to do so in all the circumstances of the case.

subsection.content: A notice published under subsection (2) is not subsidiary legislation.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Grant and renewal of discharge (fireworks) permit

subsection.content: The Secretary may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a permit permitting the discharge of manufactured fireworks for fireworks display on land.
For the purposes of section 6 of the Ordinance, a discharge (fireworks) permit is regarded as a licence granted under the Ordinance.

Despite subsection (1), the Secretary may waive in whole or in part the prescribed fee specified in item 9 of the table in section 3 of Schedule 8 if a discharge (fireworks) permit is granted or renewed in aid of or for the purposes of any charity, religious body or religious function approved by the Secretary.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Form of discharge (fireworks) permit

subsection.content: A discharge (fireworks) permit must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 75; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The permit must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the permit number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and other particulars of the permit holder;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the permit;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the location of the fireworks display;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other information the Secretary thinks fit, including the permit’s date of issue and validity period.

subsection.content: The permit must be authenticated by the Secretary.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Conditions of discharge (fireworks) permit
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Secretary may endorse on a discharge (fireworks) permit any conditions for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of manufactured fireworks permitted to be discharged;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: details of the firing point;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: protective and precautionary measures relating to the discharge of the manufactured fireworks;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: safe handling of the manufactured fireworks;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: method of discharge of the manufactured fireworks;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: person who is responsible for the handling and discharge of the manufactured fireworks.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Licensee of use (individual) licence required for fireworks display

subsection.content: The permit holder of a discharge (fireworks) permit must employ or engage at least one licensee of a use (individual) licence for the discharge of manufactured fireworks in fireworks display on land.
A permit holder who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Certain special Class 9 S1DG regarded as Class 1 S1DG
section.content: In this Division, special Class 9 S1DG that are not intact in S1DG packaging that complies with the IMDG Code are regarded as Class 1 S1DG.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Exemption of conveyance permit

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the following are exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance for conveyance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: intact special Class 9 S1DG;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Group 8 S1DG;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: explosive (whether or not falling within the definition of S1DG) in a licensed factory in such quantities as are reasonably required for, and incidental to, the manufacture of S1DG;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Class 1 S1DG within a designated conveyance area;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Class 1 S1DG within a designated possession area;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Class 1 S1DG removed from a licensed Mode A store situated in a licensed blasting site for use in the site without undue delay; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any quantity of cartridges for small arms or safety cartridges removed from a licensed store, if a licence has been granted to a person (or in the case of a body corporate, to a responsible officer on its behalf) under the Firearms and Ammunition Ordinance (Cap. 238) authorizing the removal or conveyance of the cartridges by the person.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), except with the approval of the Commissioner, a person must not convey, or cause or permit to be conveyed, on land—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: intact special Class 9 S1DG together with any other DG; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Group 8 S1DG together with any other S1DG.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Loading capacity of vehicle for conveyance of Class 1 S1DG

subsection.content: Except with the approval of the Commissioner, a vehicle must not carry more than 200 kg of explosive content of Class 1 S1DG at any one time.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a vehicle carries not more than 200 kg of explosive content of Class 1 S1DG together with not more than 2 000 detonators;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the detonators are segregated from other Class 1 S1DG by a partition that can effectively prevent an explosion or fire that occurs at one side of the partition from initiating other Class 1 S1DG at the other side; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the height of the partition is not less than the higher of the load of the detonators or other Class 1 S1DG,

subsection.continued: the detonators are not regarded as explosive content of Class 1 S1DG for the purposes of subsection (1).

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened in relation to a vehicle, the owner and driver of the vehicle each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Display of placard on vehicle

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), Class 1 S1DG must not be conveyed on a vehicle unless a placard that conforms to the following is displayed at a conspicuous place on the vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the form in the following Figure in Part 1 of Schedule 1—

subparagraph.content: for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3—Figure No. 1;
for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.4—Figure No. 2;
for special Class 9 S1DG that are mentioned in section 11 of that Schedule—Figure No. 2;
for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.5—Figure No. 3;
for Class 1 S1DG in Division 1.6—Figure No. 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specifications specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to Class 1 S1DG that are exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance for conveyance under this Part or Division 1 of Part 3 of Cap. 295E.

If subsection (1) is contravened in relation to a vehicle, the owner and driver of the vehicle each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Class 1 S1DG not permitted in public transport carrier

subsection.content: A person must not carry any Class 1 S1DG while the person is on board a public transport carrier.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: public transport carrier (公共交通工具) means a public bus, public light bus, taxi, train, light rail vehicle, tramcar or any other carrier that is used in or for publicly available services for the transportation of persons.

section.name: s82
