section.heading: Grant of conveyance permit

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant a permit permitting the conveyance of Class 1 S1DG on land from one place of origin to only one destination.
For the purposes of section 6 of the Ordinance, a conveyance permit is regarded as a licence granted under the Ordinance.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Form of conveyance permit

subsection.content: A conveyance permit must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 84; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The permit must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the permit number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and other particulars of the permit holder;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the permit;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the kind and quantity of Class 1 S1DG permitted to be conveyed in the journey;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the place of origin of the conveyance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the destination of the conveyance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any other information the Commissioner thinks fit, including the permit’s date of issue and validity period.

subsection.content: The permit must be authenticated by the Commissioner.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Conditions of conveyance permit
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Commissioner may endorse on a conveyance permit any conditions for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: route of conveyance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vehicle to be used for the conveyance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: driver of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: persons who attend to the vehicle;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: safe handling of the Class 1 S1DG conveyed.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Packing, Marking and Labelling of S1DG

section.name: s85
section.heading: Application of Division 6 of Part 2
section.leadIn: This Division does not affect the operation of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 6 of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other provision of this Regulation,

section.continued: in relation to the storage or conveyance of Class 1 S1DG and special Class 9 S1DG.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Exemption in general
section.leadIn: This Division does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Class 1 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG that—

subparagraph.content: are used in a manufacturing process in a licensed factory or a licensed blasting site, including any examination and testing necessary for the process;
are exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance for storage under this Part or Division 1 of Part 3 of Cap. 295E; or
have been removed from S1DG packaging for use without undue delay; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Group 8 S1DG.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Requirements for packing, marking and labelling

subsection.content: Subject to sections 86 and 88, a person must not store or convey, or cause or permit to be stored or conveyed, Class 1 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG unless the packing, marking and labelling requirements specified in Schedule 3 are complied with in relation to the S1DG.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Effect of compliance with IMDG Code
section.content: For the purposes of section 87, if Class 1 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG are packed, marked and labelled in conformity with the IMDG Code, the packing, marking and labelling requirements specified in Schedule 3 for storage or conveyance of the S1DG are regarded as having been complied with in relation to the S1DG.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Class 1 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG presumed to be as specified in mark or label

subsection.leadIn: If an S1DG packaging of Class 1 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG bears a mark or label, the contents of the packaging are, unless the contrary is proved, presumed to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the packaging bears a mark that specifies a UN number—S1DG of a classification or identification as per that number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the packaging bears a mark that does not specify a UN number but specifies a proper shipping name—S1DG as described by that name; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the packaging does not bear a mark but bears a label that specifies a Class of S1DG—S1DG of the relevant Class.

subsection.content: The mark or label mentioned in subsection (1) is admissible as evidence, on the face of it, of the identity of the Class 1 S1DG or special Class 9 S1DG in any civil or criminal proceedings.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Validity and Replacement of S1DG Licence or Permit

section.name: s90
section.heading: Cessation of validity of S1DG licence and permit

subsection.leadIn: An S1DG licence or permit ceases to be valid when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the validity period of the licence or permit expires;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the licence or permit—

subparagraph.content: is revoked under section 9 of the Ordinance;
is cancelled under section 17 of the Ordinance; or
is surrendered by the licensee or permit holder; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensee or permit holder dies or ceases to exist.

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a manufacture (factory) licence ceases to be valid when the licensed factory (including any S1DG process building of the factory) is demolished, destroyed or ceases to exist; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a store and use licence ceases to be valid when the licensed store is demolished, destroyed or ceases to exist.

subsection.leadIn: If an S1DG licence or permit that is granted or renewed in hard copy form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ceases to be valid under subsection (1)(b)(i) or (ii), the licensee or permit holder must surrender the licence or permit to (for a discharge (fireworks) permit) the Secretary or (for any other S1DG licence or permit) the Commissioner within 7 working days after a written notice of the revocation or cancellation is received by the licensee or permit holder; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases to be valid under subsection (2)(a) or (b), the licensee must surrender the licence to the Commissioner within 7 working days after the occurrence of the event described in that subsection.

subsection.content: A licensee or permit holder who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: S1DG licence or permit (S1危險品牌照或許可證) means—(a)a manufacture (factory) licence;(b)a manufacture (blasting) licence;(c)a store and use licence;(d)a possession licence;(e)a use (individual) licence;(f)a discharge (blasting) permit;(g)a discharge (fireworks) permit; or(h)a conveyance permit.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Replacement of S1DG licence and permit

subsection.content: If an S1DG licence or permit (other than a discharge (fireworks) permit) (original licence or permit) is lost, defaced or destroyed, the Commissioner may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the licensee or permit holder a replacement licence or replacement permit (as the case may be) in like terms.
A replacement licence or replacement permit granted under subsection (1) has the same effect as the original licence or permit.

If a discharge (fireworks) permit is lost, defaced or destroyed (original permit), the Secretary may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the permit holder a replacement permit in like terms.
A replacement permit granted under subsection (3) has the same effect as the original permit.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: S1DG licence or permit (S1危險品牌照或許可證) has the meaning given by section 90(5).

section.name: s92
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: approved tank (獲准貯槽) means a tank approved under section 114(1);
Class 3A premises (第3A類處所) means a premises in which an approved tank containing Class 3A S2DG is located;
conveyance licence (運送牌照) means a licence granted or renewed under section 117;

fire safety requirements (消防安全規定), in relation to a premises that is to be used as a licensed factory, licensed store or Class 3A premises, or a vehicle that is to be used as a licensed vehicle, means fire safety requirements issued under section 93 for the factory, store, premises or vehicle;
fire service installation or equipment (消防裝置或設備) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Fire Services Ordinance (Cap. 95);

hazardous area (危險區), in relation to a licensed factory, licensed store or Class 3A premises, means the area of, and adjacent to, the factory, store or premises that is marked as “hazardous area” on the latest plan of the factory, store or premises approved by the Director;
licensed factory (持牌工廠) means a premises in which the manufacture of S2DG is permitted under a manufacture licence;

licensed store (持牌貯存所) means a premises the use of which for the storage of S2DG is permitted under a store and use licence, and includes any fixed piping, fittings or equipment designed and constructed for the distribution of the S2DG;
licensed tank (持牌貯槽) means a licensed store—(a)that is a tank; and(b)the use of which for the storage of S2DG is permitted under a store and use licence;
licensed tank vehicle (持牌貯槽車輛) means a licensed vehicle that is a tank vehicle;
licensed vehicle (持牌車輛) means a vehicle the use of which for the conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) is permitted under a conveyance licence (including a motor tractor or trailer);

manufacture (製造)—(a)includes the filling of a pressure receptacle (other than a boiler or a pressure vessel as defined by section 2(1) of the Boilers and Pressure Vessels Ordinance (Cap. 56)) with any gas; but(b)does not include the removal of a refrigerant from a refrigeration machine or equipment and storing the refrigerant in a container designed for storing it;
manufacture licence (製造牌照) means a licence granted or renewed under section 94(1);
motor tractor (機動拖拉機) has the meaning given by regulation 2 of the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A);
paint materials (油漆物料) has the meaning given by section 2 of Cap. 295E;
pre-packed S2DG (預先包裝的S2危險品) has the meaning given to the definition of pre-packed Schedule 2 dangerous goods by section 2 of Cap. 295E;

pressure receptacle (壓力氣體容器) means a receptacle used for containing Class 2 S2DG under pressure, other than a boiler or a pressure vessel as defined by section 2(1) of the Boilers and Pressure Vessels Ordinance (Cap. 56);
quantity (分量), in relation to S2DG, has the same meaning as in section 5 of Cap. 295E;
registered contractor (註冊承辦商) has the meaning given by regulation 2 of the Fire Service (Installation Contractors) Regulations (Cap. 95 sub. leg. A);
S2DG licence (S2危險品牌照) means—(a)in relation to the manufacture of S2DG—a manufacture licence; or(b)in relation to the storage or use (or both) of S2DG—a store and use licence;

S2DG packaging (S2危險品包裝) means any receptacle (including a receptacle that forms part of pre-packed S2DG), tank or material for receiving, holding or enclosing S2DG, but does not include any freight container, aircraft container or vehicle;
store and use licence (貯存暨使用牌照) means a licence granted or renewed under section 94(2);
tank-container (液罐貨櫃) means a movable freight container designed for containing S2DG directly without any form of intermediate containment;
tank vehicle (貯槽車輛) means a vehicle for the conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) that comprises at least one tank (other than the fuel tank) permanently mounted on the chassis of the vehicle;
trailer (拖車) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374).

section.name: s93
section.heading: Director may issue fire safety requirements

subsection.content: The Director may from time to time issue fire safety requirements that set out the safety standards required for a licensed factory, licensed store, Class 3A premises (including an approved tank in it) or licensed vehicle, including its design, construction, ventilation, piping, fittings and equipment, retaining facilities and drainage, electrical installation and fittings, fire service installation or equipment, signs (including notices and placards), operation, housekeeping, management, security, staff training and emergency preparedness.
Fire safety requirements issued under subsection (1) must be formulated on a case-by-case basis after conducting individual risk assessment.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Manufacture, Storage and Use of S2DG

section.name: s94
section.heading: Grant and renewal of S2DG licence

subsection.content: The Director may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a licence mentioned in section 6 of the Ordinance permitting the manufacture of S2DG in a premises that complies with the fire safety requirements issued for the premises.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a licence mentioned in section 6 of the Ordinance permitting the licensee to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: store S2DG in a premises that complies with the fire safety requirements issued for it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so store S2DG and use them.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Form of manufacture licence

subsection.content: A manufacture licence must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 96; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date on which the licence is first granted;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the validity period of the licence;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the description and classification (including its packing group) of S2DG permitted to be manufactured;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the following particulars of the licensed factory—

subparagraph.content: the address of the factory; and
the locations at which the S2DG may be manufactured.

subsection.content: The licence must be authenticated by the Director.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Conditions of manufacture licence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Director may endorse on a manufacture licence any or all of the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence or a copy of it must be displayed in a conspicuous place at the licensed factory;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence must be produced for inspection if requested by the Director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licence must not be altered without the approval of the Director;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the fire safety requirements issued for the factory must be complied with at all times;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: adequate measures must be taken to ensure the safe operation of the factory, including the housekeeping, management, security, staff training, emergency preparedness and other control of the factory;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the layout and structure within the hazardous area of the factory must be kept in the same way as shown in the latest plan of the factory approved by the Director in writing;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: except with the Director’s written approval, no alteration or addition may be made to the factory (including any fittings or equipment in it);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the factory (including any fittings or equipment in it) must be maintained in good order and condition at all times;
the fire service installation or equipment for the factory must be kept in efficient working order;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: the fire service installation or equipment for the factory must—

subparagraph.content: be inspected by a registered contractor at least once in every 12 months; and

be certified, after the inspection, to be in efficient working order by a certificate issued by the registered contractor under regulation 9 of the Fire Service (Installations and Equipment) Regulations (Cap. 95 sub. leg. B);

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the fire service installation or equipment for the factory must not be obstructed by any thing in a way that may affect its operation;

paragraph.leadIn: if there is any incident of explosion or fire in, in the vicinity of or in connection with the factory, or any leak of S2DG from the factory—

subparagraph.content: the incident must be reported immediately to the Director; and
if loss of life or personal injury is caused by the incident—the loss or injury must also be reported immediately to the Director;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: any spill or leakage of S2DG must be stemmed and handled promptly.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Form of store and use licence

subsection.content: A store and use licence must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 98; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date on which the licence is first granted;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the validity period of the licence;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the following particulars of S2DG permitted to be stored or used—

subparagraph.content: the description of the S2DG;
the classification (including its packing group) of the S2DG; and
the maximum quantity for the storage and use of the S2DG in aggregate;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the following particulars of the licensed store—

subparagraph.content: the address of the store; and
the locations at which the S2DG may be stored;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the locations at which the S2DG may be used (if applicable).

subsection.content: The licence must be authenticated by the Director.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Conditions of store and use licence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Director may endorse on a store and use licence any or all of the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence or a copy of it must be displayed in a conspicuous place at the licensed store;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence must be produced for inspection if requested by the Director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licence must not be altered without the approval of the Director;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the quantity for the storage and use of S2DG in aggregate must not exceed the maximum quantity for the storage and use in aggregate as specified in the licence;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: when the S2DG specified in the licence are not in use, they must be returned to the store for storage;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the fire safety requirements issued for the store must be complied with at all times;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: adequate measures must be taken to ensure the safe operation of the store, including the housekeeping, management, security, staff training, emergency preparedness and other control of the store;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the layout and structure within the hazardous area of the store must be kept in the same way as shown in the latest plan of the store approved by the Director in writing;
the store (including any fittings or equipment in it) must be maintained in good order and condition at all times;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the store and all other areas in the hazardous area must be maintained in a clean and tidy condition;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: the store must not be used for the storage of any thing or dangerous goods (other than the S2DG specified in the licence), except—

subparagraph.content: any thing that is necessary to facilitate the storage of the S2DG; or
an empty receptacle used for containing the S2DG;

paragraph.content: if there is any ventilation opening provided in the store, the opening must not be obstructed;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: no vehicle may be parked in the hazardous area of the store for any purpose other than refueling;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: one way traffic flow must be maintained for the entry and exit routes for a store that is a refueling station;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: when a vehicle delivers fuel to the store, a safe emergency route must be maintained;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: S2DG must not be placed outside the store for any purpose or duration, unless the S2DG are in use or the placing of the goods is reasonably necessary in the course of handling the S2DG;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: the fire service installation or equipment for the store must be kept in efficient working order;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.leadIn: the fire service installation or equipment for the store must—

subparagraph.content: be inspected by a registered contractor at least once in every 12 months; and

be certified, after the inspection, to be in efficient working order by a certificate issued by the registered contractor under regulation 9 of the Fire Service (Installations and Equipment) Regulations (Cap. 95 sub. leg. B);

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: the fire service installation or equipment for the store must not be obstructed by any thing in a way that may affect its operation;

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.leadIn: if there is any incident of explosion or fire in, in the vicinity of or in connection with the store, or any leak of S2DG from the store—

subparagraph.content: the incident must be reported immediately to the Director; and
if loss of life or personal injury is caused by the incident—the loss or injury must also be reported immediately to the Director;

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: any spill or leakage of S2DG must be stemmed and handled promptly;

if a licensed tank is inspected under regulation 8 of the Building (Oil Storage Installations) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. K) and, after the inspection, a certificate of inspection is issued under that regulation, a copy of the certificate must be delivered to the Director as soon as practicable.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Cessation of validity of S2DG licence

subsection.leadIn: An S2DG licence ceases to be valid when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the validity period of the licence expires;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the licence—

subparagraph.content: is revoked under section 9 of the Ordinance;
is cancelled under section 17 of the Ordinance; or
is surrendered by the licensee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensee dies or ceases to exist.

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a manufacture licence ceases to be valid when the licensed factory is demolished, destroyed or ceases to exist; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a store and use licence ceases to be valid when the licensed store is demolished, destroyed or ceases to exist.

subsection.leadIn: If an S2DG licence that is granted or renewed in hard copy form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ceases to be valid under subsection (1)(b)(i) or (ii), the licensee must surrender the licence to the Director within 7 working days after a written notice of the revocation or cancellation is received by the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases to be valid under subsection (2)(a) or (b), the licensee must surrender the licence to the Director within 7 working days after the occurrence of the event described in that subsection.

subsection.content: A licensee who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Replacement of S2DG licence

subsection.content: If an S2DG licence (original licence) is lost, defaced or destroyed, the Director may, on application and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the licensee a replacement licence in like terms.
A replacement licence granted under subsection (1) has the same effect as the original licence.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Restriction on alteration or addition etc. without approval

subsection.content: The licensee of a store and use licence must not make any alteration or addition, or cause or permit any alteration or addition to be made, to the licensed store that results in any deviation in any material particular from the latest plan of the store approved by the Director.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an alteration or addition approved by the Director.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Licensee of store and use licence to provide particulars of S2DG

subsection.content: The licensee of a store and use licence must, if requested by the Director, provide the Director with particulars of the S2DG contained in the store.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Use of defective licensed tank prohibited

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Director that a licensed tank for which a store and use licence is issued is, by reason of its condition, not suitable to be used for the storage of S2DG or unsafe, the Director may, by written notice served on the licensee of the licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibit the use of the tank for the storage of S2DG; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permit the use of the tank for the storage of S2DG subject to the conditions specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notice under subsection (1), the licensee must immediately cease to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(a) applies—use the tank for the storage of S2DG; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(b) applies—use the tank for the storage of S2DG in contravention of the conditions specified in the notice.

subsection.content: A licensee of a store and use licence who is aggrieved by a notice served under subsection (1) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board established under the Administrative Appeals Board Ordinance (Cap. 442).
An appeal under subsection (3) against a notice under subsection (1) does not relieve the licensee from complying with subsection (2) pending the determination of the appeal.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Restrictions and Safety Precautions for Manufacture and Storage of S2DG

section.name: s104
section.heading: Smoking, carrying lighted cigarette, etc. prohibited in hazardous area of licensed factory, licensed store or Class 3A premises

subsection.content: A person must not smoke or carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe in the hazardous area of a licensed factory, licensed store or Class 3A premises.

subsection.leadIn: A person who carries out an operation described in subsection (3) must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: smoke; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe.

subsection.content: For subsection (2), the operation is one that involves loading S2DG into, or discharging S2DG from, a licensed factory, licensed store or Class 3A premises.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s105
section.heading: Use of fire, flame, etc. prohibited in hazardous area of licensed store or Class 3A premises

subsection.leadIn: A person must not use, or cause or permit to be used, any naked light, flame or other source of substantial heat, or other means of igniting flammable substances or vapour in the hazardous area of a licensed store or Class 3A premises, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prior approval of the Director has been obtained; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all of the following conditions are met—

subparagraph.content: all S2DG have been removed from the licensed store or Class 3A premises;

if the storage of Class 2.1 S2DG, Class 3 S2DG, Class 3A S2DG, Class 4 S2DG or Class 5 S2DG, or S2DG of any other class with subsidiary hazard of 2.1, 3, 4.1, 4.2, 4.3 or 5.1 is involved—a person approved under subsection (2) has certified that all areas in the hazardous area of the licensed store or Class 3A premises are free from flammable vapour.

subsection.content: The Director may, on application, approve a person for the purposes of making a certification mentioned in subsection (1)(b)(ii).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s106
section.heading: Fire, forge, etc. not be sited near licensed store or Class 3A premises

subsection.leadIn: A person must not site, or cause or permit fire, forge, furnace or other source of substantial heat to be sited, in an area that is within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the hazardous area of a licensed store or Class 3A premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 6 metres of the store or premises.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the siting of the fire, forge, furnace or other source of substantial heat is approved by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the site is separated from the licensed store or Class 3A premises by a fire resisting wall of the dimensions and construction required by the Director.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s107
section.heading: Licensed store and Class 3A premises kept locked

subsection.content: A person who manages, controls, keeps or operates a licensed store or Class 3A premises must cause every entrance to it to be at all times securely closed and (if it was equipped with any locking device at the time of grant of the relevant licence or approval) locked, except when access is required to the store or premises for the inspection, maintenance or handling of the S2DG in it.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s108
section.heading: Children and unauthorized person not permitted in licensed store or Class 3A premises

subsection.leadIn: A person must not enter or remain in a licensed store or Class 3A premises unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 14; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has obtained the permission of—

subparagraph.content: the Director;
for a licensed store, the licensee of the licensed store; or
for a Class 3A premises, the owner or person in charge of the premises.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Restriction on installation of electrical apparatus

subsection.leadIn: A person must not install, or cause or permit to be installed, an electrical apparatus in the hazardous area of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed store in which any Class 2.1 S2DG, Class 3 S2DG, Class 3A S2DG, Class 4 S2DG or Class 5 S2DG, or S2DG of any other class with subsidiary hazard of 2.1, 3, 4.1, 4.2, 4.3 or 5.1 are stored; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Class 3A premises.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the electrical apparatus and its wiring are designed and installed in a way that they do not ignite flammable vapour during the operation of the apparatus; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the electrical apparatus and its wiring are installed—

subparagraph.content: after an application for the installation has been approved by the Director; and
in compliance with the standard specified in the fire safety requirements issued for the store or premises after an application to the Director for the installation is made.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Restriction on storage of different types of S2DG

subsection.content: A person must not store, or cause or permit to be stored, 2 or more types of S2DG (whether or not of the same class) that are incompatible in a licensed store.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), 2 or more types of S2DG are incompatible if, when they come into contact with each other or all others—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a combustion occurs or is likely to occur;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: considerable heat is, or is likely to be, generated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a flammable, asphyxiant, oxidizing or toxic gas is, or is likely to be, generated;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a corrosive substance is, or is likely to be, formed; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a chemically unstable substance is, or is likely to be, formed.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Class 2 S2DG must not be stored with S2DG of a different class;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Class 3 S2DG must not be stored with S2DG of a different class, except Class 3A S2DG or paint materials that are Class 3 S2DG or Class 8 S2DG;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Class 3A S2DG must not be stored with S2DG of a different class, except Class 3 S2DG or paint materials that are Class 3 S2DG or Class 8 S2DG; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Class 4 S2DG, Class 5 S2DG, Class 6.1 S2DG, Class 8 S2DG or Class 9 S2DG must not be stored with Class 2 S2DG, Class 3 S2DG or Class 3A S2DG, or S2DG of any other class so specified for the purposes of this paragraph in the code of practice.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Water not to be introduced into licensed store containing Class 4.3 S2DG

subsection.content: A person must not introduce water, or cause or permit the introduction of water, into a licensed store containing Class 4.3 S2DG or S2DG of any other class with subsidiary hazard of 4.3.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Repair of tank

subsection.leadIn: A person must not repair, or cause or permit the repair of, a tank that has been used to store Class 2.1 S2DG, Class 3 S2DG, Class 3A S2DG, Class 4 S2DG or Class 5 S2DG, or S2DG of any other class with subsidiary hazard of 2.1, 3, 4.1, 4.2, 4.3 or 5.1 by any means involving—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the use of any source of artificial heat; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a process producing heat or sparking, or a process likely to produce heat or sparking.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply if a person approved under subsection (3) has certified that a tank is free from flammable vapour.
The Director may, on application, approve a person for the purposes of making a certification mentioned in subsection (2).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Decommissioning of tank

subsection.leadIn: If a tank has been used for the storage of S2DG but is no longer so used, the person who owns or possesses the tank must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: take necessary steps to decommission the tank; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inform the Director on completion of the decommissioning.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is a natural person who cannot be readily found or a body corporate that is not incorporated in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the tank was owned by or in the possession of—

subparagraph.content: a natural person immediately before the person’s death; or
a body corporate immediately before its dissolution,

subsection.continued: the Director may, by written notice served on a specified person, require the specified person to take necessary steps to decommission the tank within a reasonable period specified in the notice and inform the Director on completion of the decommissioning.

subsection.content: A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.
A specified person on whom a notice is served under subsection (2) must comply with the notice within the period specified in it.
A specified person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明的人), in relation to a tank located in a premises, means the owner, person in charge, tenant or occupier of the premises.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Approved Tank for Containing Class 3A S2DG (Diesel Oil, Furnace Oil and other Fuel Oil)

section.name: s114
section.heading: Application for approval of tank

subsection.content: The Director may, on application, approve the use of a tank for containing Class 3A S2DG.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a tank was approved for the purposes of regulation 99A of the repealed Cap. 295B; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval is in force immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: the tank is deemed to be approved under subsection (1).

subsection.content: A tank deemed under subsection (2) to be approved is exempt from the operation of sections 6 and 10 of the Ordinance.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) by Licensed Vehicle

section.name: s115
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 6 of Part 3
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: identification disc (識別證), in relation to a licensed vehicle, means the identification disc issued for the vehicle under section 117(2);

registered owner (登記車主)—(a)in relation to a vehicle, has the meaning given by section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374); and(b)in relation to a village vehicle as defined by that section, means the holder of a village vehicle permit as defined by that section issued in respect of the vehicle.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Conveyance Licence and other Requirements for S2DG (Class 2/3/3A)

section.name: s116
section.heading: Conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) by licensed vehicle

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person must not use, or cause or permit to be used, a vehicle for the conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) (including such S2DG placed inside a freight container) unless the vehicle is a licensed vehicle for conveying the S2DG (Class 2/3/3A).
Subsection (1) does not apply to a conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) that is exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance under Part 3 in Cap. 295E.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s117
section.heading: Grant and renewal of conveyance licence

subsection.content: The Director may, on application by the registered owner of a vehicle or any person authorized by the owner and payment of the prescribed fee, grant or renew a licence mentioned in section 6 of the Ordinance permitting the use of the vehicle for the conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A).
On granting a conveyance licence, the Director must also issue to the licensee an identification disc for identifying the vehicle.

section.name: s118
section.heading: Form of conveyance licence

subsection.content: A conveyance licence must be in English and Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to the conditions endorsed on it under section 119; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that it is subject to those conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must include all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee for the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date on which the licence is first granted;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the validity period of the licence;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the classification of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) (including its Class or type) permitted to be conveyed by the licensed vehicle;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the following particulars of the licensed vehicle—

subparagraph.content: its vehicle registration mark;
its engine number; and
its chassis number;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the area in which S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) may be conveyed by the licensed vehicle.

subsection.content: The licence must be authenticated by the Director.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Conditions of conveyance licence
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 9 of the Ordinance, the Director may endorse on a conveyance licence any or all of the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence and the identification disc of the licensed vehicle must not be altered without the approval of the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fire safety requirements issued for the vehicle must be complied with at all times;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the vehicle (including any fittings or equipment in it) must be maintained in good order and condition at all times;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: adequate measures must be taken to ensure the safe operation of the vehicle, including the housekeeping, management, security, staff training, emergency preparedness and other control of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the fire service installation or equipment for the vehicle must be kept in efficient working order;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the fire service installation or equipment for the vehicle must not be obstructed by any thing on the vehicle in a way that may affect its operation;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the vehicle must not be used for the conveyance of any thing other than the S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) specified in the licence (permitted S2DG), except—

subparagraph.content: any thing that is necessary to facilitate the conveyance of permitted S2DG; or
an empty receptacle used for containing permitted S2DG;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) must be carried in the cargo compartment of the vehicle;

paragraph.leadIn: S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) must not be carried—

subparagraph.content: in a tank on the vehicle unless the tank is approved by the Director; or
in a tank-container on the vehicle unless the construction of the tank-container is in conformity with the IMDG Code;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the vehicle must only convey S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) in the area specified in the licence;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: if the vehicle is a motor tractor, it must be operated together with a trailer that is a licensed vehicle;
if the vehicle is a trailer, it must be operated together with a motor tractor that is a licensed vehicle;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) in packaged form must be secured by suitable means that is capable of restraining the S2DG in the vehicle in a manner that prevents, during the conveyance process, any movement that would cause the S2DG packaging to be damaged or result in any accidental release of the S2DG;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.leadIn: if there is any incident of explosion or fire in, in the vicinity of or in connection with the vehicle, or any leak of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) from the vehicle—

subparagraph.content: the incident must be reported immediately to the Director; and
if loss of life or personal injury is caused by the incident—the loss or injury must also be reported immediately to the Director;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: any spill or leakage of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) must be stemmed and handled promptly.

section.name: s120
section.heading: Cessation of validity of conveyance licence

subsection.leadIn: A conveyance licence ceases to be valid when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the validity period of the licence expires;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the licence—

subparagraph.content: is revoked under section 9 of the Ordinance;
is cancelled under section 17 of the Ordinance; or
is surrendered by the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensed vehicle specified in the licence is broken up or destroyed; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the licensee—

subparagraph.content: ceases to be the registered owner of the vehicle; or
dies or ceases to exist.

subsection.leadIn: If a conveyance licence that is granted or renewed in hard copy form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ceases to be valid under subsection (1)(b)(i) or (ii), the licensee must surrender the licence and identification disc to the Director within 7 working days after a written notice of the revocation or cancellation is received by the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases to be valid under subsection (1)(c) or (d)(i), the licensee must surrender the licence and identification disc to the Director within 7 working days after the occurrence of the event described in subsection (1)(c) or (d)(i).

subsection.content: A licensee who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s121
section.heading: Replacement of conveyance licence and identification disc

subsection.content: If a conveyance licence (original licence) or an identification disc (original disc) granted or issued to a licensee is lost, defaced or destroyed, the Director may, on application by the licensee of the original licence or a person authorized in writing by the licensee and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the licensee a replacement conveyance licence and issue a replacement identification disc in like terms.
A replacement licence has the same effect as the original licence.
A replacement identification disc has the same effect as the original disc.

section.name: s122
section.heading: Requirement to display identification disc

subsection.leadIn: A person must not convey, or cause or permit to be conveyed, S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) by a licensed vehicle unless an identification disc issued for the vehicle is displayed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the vehicle has an engine and a fixed windscreen—on the left hand side of the windscreen in a manner that the disc is clearly visible from the front of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the vehicle has an engine but not a fixed windscreen—at a conspicuous place on the left hand side of the front of the vehicle in a manner that the disc is clearly visible from the front of the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the vehicle does not have an engine—at a conspicuous place near the registration plate on the vehicle.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s123
section.heading: Licensee to provide particulars of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A)

subsection.content: The licensee of a conveyance licence must, if requested by the Director, provide the Director with the particulars of the S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) conveyed by the licensed vehicle.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s124
section.heading: Examination of licensed vehicle

subsection.content: The Director may, by written notice served on the licensee of a conveyance licence, require the licensee to produce the licensed vehicle for examination, at the time and place specified in the notice, to ascertain whether the vehicle is suitable for the conveyance of the S2DG (Class 2/3/3A).
A vehicle produced under subsection (1) may only be kept at the place of examination for a reasonable period.
A licensee who fails to comply with a notice served under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s125
section.heading: Use of defective tank on licensed tank vehicle prohibited

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Director that a tank on a licensed tank vehicle for which a conveyance licence is issued is, by reason of its condition, not suitable to be used to contain S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) or unsafe, the Director may, by written notice served on the licensee of the licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibit the use of the tank for containing S2DG; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permit the use of the tank for containing S2DG subject to the conditions specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notice under subsection (1), the licensee must immediately cease to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(a) applies—use the tank for containing S2DG; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(b) applies—use the tank for containing S2DG in contravention of the conditions specified in the notice.

subsection.content: A licensee of a conveyance licence who is aggrieved by a notice served under subsection (1) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board established under the Administrative Appeals Board Ordinance (Cap. 442).
An appeal under subsection (3) against a notice under subsection (1) does not relieve the licensee from complying with subsection (2) pending the determination of the appeal.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s126
section.heading: Notification of change of particulars of licensee

subsection.content: If there is a change in any particulars of the licensee of a conveyance licence, the licensee must, within 7 working days of the change, notify the Director in writing of the change.

On receiving a notification under subsection (1), if the Director is satisfied that the change has occurred and an amendment to the particulars in the relevant conveyance licence or identification disc (or both) is required, the Director may amend the particulars in the licence or identification disc (or both), and grant another licence and issue another identification disc to the licensee.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: particulars (詳情), in relation to the licensee of a conveyance licence, include the following particulars of the licencee—(a)name;(b)address;(c)telephone number;(d)details of the identity document (as defined by regulation 2 of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E)).

section.name: s127
section.heading: Notification of cessation of ownership

subsection.content: If the licensee of a conveyance licence ceases to be the registered owner of the licensed vehicle, the licensee must, within 7 working days of the cessation, notify the Director in writing of the change.
A licensee who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s128
section.heading: Restriction on alteration etc. without approval

subsection.leadIn: The licensee of a conveyance licence must not make any alteration or addition, or cause or permit any alteration or addition to be made, to the licensed vehicle (including any fittings or equipment in it) that may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: result in any deviation in its design or construction approved by the Director before the licence is granted or renewed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affect the ability of the vehicle to convey S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) safely.

subsection.content: For subsection (1)(a), the design or construction of a licensed vehicle includes the design or construction of the engine, fuel tank, cargo compartment, tank, fire resisting shield, electrical system, fittings or equipment of the vehicle.
A licensee who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s129
section.heading: Licence not required for conveyance of certain quantity of kerosene

subsection.content: Despite section 116(1), the conveyance of kerosene on a pedal cycle or motor cycle is exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance for conveyance if not more than 40 litres of kerosene is conveyed at any one time.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: kerosene (煤油) means S2DG with UN number UN 1223 specified in Part 2 of Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;
motor cycle (電單車) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374).

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Restrictions and Safety Precautions for Conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A)

section.name: s130
section.heading: Restriction on conveyance of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) of different classes

subsection.leadIn: A person must not convey, or cause or permit to be conveyed, by a licensed vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Class 2 S2DG with S2DG of a different class;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Class 3 S2DG with S2DG of a different class, except Class 3A S2DG or paint materials that are Class 3 S2DG or Class 8 S2DG; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Class 3A S2DG with S2DG of a different class, except Class 3 S2DG or paint materials that are Class 3 S2DG or Class 8 S2DG.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s131
section.heading: Display of warning sign and placard on licensed vehicle

subsection.leadIn: A person must not convey, or cause or permit to be conveyed, S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) by a licensed vehicle unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a warning sign is displayed at a conspicuous place at the front and rear of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or more than one placards showing the class or classes of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) carried on the vehicle are displayed at a conspicuous place on both sides and the rear of the vehicle.

subsection.content: A warning sign required under subsection (1)(a) must conform with the form in Figure No. 1 in Part 1 of Schedule 4 and the specifications specified in Part 2 of Schedule 4.

subsection.leadIn: A placard or placards required under subsection (1)(b) must conform with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the form in the following Figure in Part 1 of Schedule 5—

subparagraph.content: for Class 2.1 S2DG—Figure No. 1a or 1b;
for Class 2.2 S2DG—Figure No. 2a or 2b;
for Class 2.3 S2DG—Figure No. 3;
for Class 3 S2DG or Class 3A S2DG—Figure No. 4a or 4b; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specifications specified in Part 2 of Schedule 5.

subsection.content: If 2 placards prescribed in Part 1 of Schedule 5 bear the same figure number but are followed by different letters, the reference to “one or more than one placards” in subsection (1)(b) is to be read as a reference to either of those placards.
A person who contravenes subsection (1)(a) or (b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s132
section.heading: Licensed vehicle to be attended to

subsection.leadIn: The driver of a licensed vehicle conveying S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) must ensure that the vehicle is attended to by himself or herself or by another person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 18;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is authorized by the driver; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: is aware of—

subparagraph.content: if the driver is not attending to the vehicle—the whereabouts of the driver; and
the nature of the S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) on the vehicle.

subsection.content: A driver who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s133
section.heading: No smoking, lighted cigarette, etc. in operations relating to licensed vehicle

subsection.leadIn: A person who carries out an operation described in subsection (2) must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: smoke;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry a lighted cigarette, cigar or pipe; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: carry a naked flame.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), the operation is one that involves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: using a licensed vehicle to convey S2DG (Class 2/3/3A); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: loading S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) onto, or unloading S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) from, a licensed vehicle.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s134
section.heading: Direct transfer of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) from licensed vehicle prohibited

subsection.content: A person must not fuel a vehicle or vessel directly from a licensed vehicle.
A person must not transfer S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) directly from a licensed vehicle to a tank or tank-container on another licensed vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not transfer S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) directly from a licensed vehicle to a receptacle, except to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved tank; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a receptacle located in—

subparagraph.content: a licensed factory or licensed store; or
a premises in which the storage of the S2DG is exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance under Cap. 295E.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2) and (3) do not apply to a transfer of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) from a licensed vehicle if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle is in such a condition that continuing to use it to convey the S2DG may cause a fire or other occurrence that endangers life or property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vehicle is involved in an accident or emergency that calls for the transfer without undue delay.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

If a person is charged under subsection (5) with an offence for contravening subsection (3) in relation to a transfer of S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) to a receptacle located in a place that did not fall within the description of subsection (3)(b)(i) or (ii), it is a defence for the person to show that, having used his or her best endeavour to make enquiry with the person in charge of the place, he or she reasonably believed that the place fell within that description.

section.name: s135
section.heading: Electrostatic charges on licensed vehicle

subsection.content: When Class 2.1 S2DG, Class 3 S2DG or Class 3A S2DG is being loaded onto or unloaded from a tank or tank-container on a licensed vehicle, adequate precaution (as specified in the code of practice for the purposes of this subsection) must be taken to prevent the accumulation of electrostatic charges.

If subsection (1) is contravened, the person who controls or operates the loading or unloading operation commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s136
section.heading: Passenger on licensed vehicle

subsection.content: A person must not drive a licensed vehicle that has S2DG (Class 2/3/3A) on board while any passenger other than a person employed or engaged to handle the S2DG in the course of the conveyance is on the vehicle.
If subsection (1) is contravened in relation to a licensed vehicle, the driver of the vehicle commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

section.name: s137
section.heading: Repair of tank on licensed tank vehicle

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a tank on a licensed tank vehicle that has been used to contain Class 2.1 S2DG, Class 3 S2DG or Class 3A S2DG; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a compartment of the tank (including the piping connected to the tank).

subsection.leadIn: A person must not repair, or cause or permit the repair of, a tank or any compartment of it if the repair involves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the use of any source of artificial heat; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a process producing heat or sparking, or a process likely to produce heat or sparking,

subsection.continued: unless a person approved under subsection (3) has certified that the tank or compartment is free from flammable vapour.

subsection.content: The Director may, on application, approve a person for the purposes of making a certification mentioned in subsection (2).
A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Packing, Marking and Labelling of S2DG

section.name: s138
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 7 of Part 3
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: limited packs (限量裝), in relation to S2DG, means—(a)for the pre-packed S2DG—the capacity of the receptacle forming part of the pre-packed S2DG does not exceed the limited quantity (if any) specified in column 8 of the table in Part 2, 3 or 4 of Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E in relation to the S2DG; or(b)for the S2DG that are contained directly without any form of intermediate containment in a receptacle—the capacity of the receptacle does not exceed the limited quantity (if any) specified in column 8 of the table in relation to the S2DG;
non-refillable pressure receptacle (不可重注的壓力氣體容器) means a pressure receptacle that—(a)contains or has contained Class 2 S2DG; and(b)is not constructed or intended to be refilled with Class 2 S2DG;
proper shipping name (正式運輸名稱), in relation to any S2DG, means the name of the S2DG specified in column 2 of the table in Part 2, 3 or 4 of Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;
refillable pressure receptacle (可重注的壓力氣體容器) means a pressure receptacle that—(a)contains or has contained Class 2 S2DG; and(b)is constructed or intended to be refilled with Class 2 S2DG.

section.name: s139
section.heading: Application of Division 7 of Part 3
section.leadIn: This Division does not affect the operation of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 6 of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other provision of this Regulation,

section.continued: in relation to the storage or conveyance of S2DG.

section.name: s140
section.heading: Exemption in general

subsection.leadIn: This Division does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: S2DG in consumer packs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: S2DG with UN number UN 3065 specified in Part 2 of Schedule 2 to Cap. 295E;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Class 3A S2DG in an approved tank; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: S2DG that are—

subparagraph.content: contained in a receptacle that is permanently installed in and forming part of a machinery; and
used or intended to be used for the proper functioning of the machinery.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: consumer packs (消費裝) has the meaning given by section 2 of Cap. 295E.

section.name: s141
section.heading: Exemption on marking and labelling of S2DG
section.content: The marking and labelling requirements under section 142 do not apply to S2DG in limited packs.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Packing, Marking and Labelling of S2DG

section.name: s142
section.heading: Requirements for packing, marking and labelling

subsection.content: A person must not store or convey, or cause or permit to be stored or conveyed, S2DG unless the packing, marking and labelling requirements specified in Schedule 6 are complied with in relation to the S2DG.

If 2 labels prescribed in Division 2 of Part 3 of Schedule 6 bear the same figure number but are followed by different letters, the reference to “a label” in section 13 of Schedule 6 is to be read as a reference to either of those labels.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s143
section.heading: Effect of compliance with IMDG Code

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), if S2DG are packed, marked and labelled in conformity with the IMDG Code, the packing, marking and labelling requirements specified in Schedule 6 for storage or conveyance of the S2DG under this Division are regarded as having been complied with in relation to the S2DG.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the packing, marking and labelling requirements for Class 3A S2DG under section 142; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the special packing requirements for a pressure receptacle under section 145.

section.name: s144
section.heading: S2DG presumed to be as specified in mark or label

subsection.leadIn: If an S2DG packaging bears a mark or label, the contents of the packaging are, unless the contrary is proved, presumed to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the packaging bears a mark that specifies a UN number or HK number—S2DG of a classification or identification as per that number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the packaging bears a mark that does not specify a UN number or HK number but specifies a proper shipping name or true name—S2DG as described by that name; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the packaging does not bear a mark that falls within the description of paragraph (a) or (b) but bears a label that specifies a Class of S2DG—S2DG of the relevant Class.

subsection.content: The mark or label mentioned in subsection (1) is admissible as evidence, on the face of it, of the identity of the S2DG in any civil or criminal proceedings.

section.name: s145
section.heading: Special packing requirements for pressure receptacle

subsection.leadIn: A person must not use a pressure receptacle for containing any Class 2 S2DG unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the receptacle is of a type approved by the Director as being appropriate for containing the Class 2 S2DG;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the receptacle is inspected or tested—

subparagraph.content: in accordance with the standard specified in the code of practice;
at the frequency specified in the code of practice; and
by a person approved by the Director for the purposes of such inspection or testing; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the receptacle has passed the inspection or testing.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pressure receptacle (whether a refillable pressure receptacle or a non-refillable pressure receptacle) that contains Class 2 S2DG in limited packs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a non-refillable pressure receptacle in respect of which all of the following conditions are met—

subparagraph.content: the receptacle is manufactured in accordance with the standard specified in the code of practice;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the receptacle contains Class 2 S2DG directly without any form of intermediate containment and its water capacity does not exceed 1 litre;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the receptacle contains Class 2.1 S2DG or Class 2.2 S2DG directly without any form of intermediate containment the pressure of which does not exceed 35 bars and its water capacity does not exceed 25 litres; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the receptacle contains Class 2.1 S2DG or Class 2.2 S2DG directly without any form of intermediate containment the pressure of which exceeds 35 bars but does not exceed 250 bars and its water capacity does not exceed 5 litres.

section.name: s146
section.heading: Record of inspection or testing of pressure receptacle

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a pressure receptacle must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep a record of the inspection or testing of the receptacle conducted in compliance with section 145(1)(b) (including any record transferred under paragraph (c));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if requested by the Director, produce the record to the Director for inspection; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on the transfer of ownership of the receptacle, transfer the record to the new owner.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(a), the record must include all of the following information in respect of each inspection or testing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person who conducted the inspection or testing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of the inspection or testing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the details of the inspection or testing;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the results of the inspection or testing.

subsection.content: If the owner of a pressure receptacle contravenes subsection (1), the owner commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 month.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Storage of Air Cargo DG at Hong Kong International Airport

section.name: s147
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: air cargo DG (空運危險品) means—(a)S2DG; or(b)any other dangerous goods (other than S1DG) that fall within the definition of dangerous goods in section 2 of the Dangerous Goods (Consignment by Air) (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 384);
air cargo terminal (空運貨站) means a franchised air-freight terminal at the Hong Kong International Airport;

air cargo terminal operator (空運貨站經營人), in relation to an air cargo terminal, means—(a)the person who owns or manages the terminal; or(b)an employee employed by, or an agent engaged by, the person for operating or managing the terminal;
licensed store (持牌貯存所) has the meaning given by section 92.

section.name: s148
section.heading: Storage of air cargo DG at air cargo terminal

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the storage of air cargo DG (DG A) unloaded from an aircraft at the Hong Kong International Airport in a licensed store in an air cargo terminal together with other air cargo DG (DG B) is exempt from the operation of section 110.
Subsection (1) only applies if both DG A and DG B are packed, marked and labelled in compliance with the Dangerous Goods (Consignment by Air) (Safety) Regulations (Cap. 384 sub. leg. A).
An air cargo terminal operator must ensure that the air cargo DG (whether DG A or DG B) are not stored in the licensed store for a period exceeding 72 hours.
An air cargo terminal operator who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 months.

section.name: s149
section.heading: Notification to Director of storage of Class 9A S3DG

subsection.content: If the quantity of Class 9A S3DG stored in a premises (other than an approved container terminal specified in Schedule 2 to the Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. F)) exceeds the specified quantity for the premises, the person who stores the Class 9A S3DG in the premises must, within 48 hours after the quantity being exceeded, send a written notice to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The notice sent under subsection (1) must contain all of the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address of the premises (including the floor number) and the type of the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the description and quantity of the Class 9A S3DG stored in the premises;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the purpose for which the Class 9A S3DG are stored in the premises.

subsection.content: If, after the notice is sent under subsection (1), there is any increase in the quantity of Class 9A S3DG stored in the premises, the person who stores the Class 9A S3DG in the premises must, within 48 hours of the increase, send to the Director another written notice containing the information specified in subsection (2).
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

If a person who sent a written notice under subsection (1) or (3) wilfully or recklessly makes a statement or provides any information that is false in a material particular, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: industrial premises (工業處所) has the meaning given by section 2 of Cap. 295E, and includes an open space used exclusively for storing Class 9A S3DG;
non-industrial premises (非工業處所) means a premises other than an industrial premises;

specified quantity (指明分量), in relation to an item of Class 9A S3DG described in column 1 in section 2 of Schedule 7, means—(a)for a non-industrial premises—the quantity specified in column 2 in section 2 of the Schedule corresponding to the item; and(b)for an industrial premises—the quantity specified in column 3 in section 2 of the Schedule corresponding to the item.

section.name: s150
section.heading: Director may issue direction

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, in respect of a premises used for the storage of Class 9A S3DG, issue a direction to the owner or occupier of the premises to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibit the use of naked light or flame of any description in the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the placing of one or more notices in the premises that bear the English words “Smoking Prohibited” and the Chinese characters “嚴禁吸煙” the height of which must not be less than 180 mm; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: prescribe the conditions subject to which the Class 9A S3DG must be stored, including conditions relating to—

subparagraph.content: the nature and construction of the receptacle in which the Class 9A S3DG are stored;
the maintenance of free access way within the premises; or
the provision and maintenance in good working order of adequate fire service installation or equipment in the premises.

subsection.content: An owner or occupier who fails to comply with a direction issued under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Storage of Freight Container in Approved Container Terminal

section.name: s151
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: approved container terminal (認可貨櫃碼頭) means a container terminal specified in Schedule 2 to the Dangerous Goods (Shipping) Regulation 2012 (Cap. 295 sub. leg. F);

container terminal operator (貨櫃碼頭經營人), in relation to an approved container terminal, means—(a)the person who owns or manages the terminal; or(b)an employee employed by, or an agent engaged by, the person for operating or managing the terminal;

designated storage area (指定貯存區域), in relation to an approved container terminal, means an area in the terminal that is designated by the container terminal operator for the storage of freight containers containing S2DG;
licensed store (持牌貯存所) has the meaning given by section 92.

section.name: s152
section.heading: Storage of freight container containing S2DG exempted from section 6 of Ordinance

subsection.content: If the conditions specified in subsections (2) and (3) are met, the storage of a freight container containing S2DG (irrespective of quantity) at a designated storage area in an approved container terminal is exempt from the operation of section 6 of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For a freight container containing S2DG (Class 2/3/3A), the condition is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the freight container is stored during the first 72 hours from the time it was unloaded at the approved container terminal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the freight container is stored during the 96 hours immediately following the 72 hours mentioned in paragraph (a), documentary proof is submitted to the Director of Marine during that 96-hour period to prove that—

subparagraph.content: a connecting vessel scheduled to arrive at the terminal within 72 hours from the time the container was unloaded at the terminal fails to arrive within that 72 hours; and
an onward carrying vessel has been arranged to remove the container from the terminal within 7 days after the date on which the container was unloaded at the terminal.

subsection.leadIn: For a freight container containing S2DG other than S2DG (Class 2/3/3A), the conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirements in the IMDG Code for the S2DG concerning packing, marking and labelling are complied with in relation to the container;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the container is segregated in stacks at the designated storage area in accordance with the IMO recommendations relating to horizontal and longitudinal separations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: within 21 days from the date on which the container was unloaded at the approved container terminal, it is removed to a licensed store.
