subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: IMO recommendations (《IMO建議》) means the Revised Recommendations on the Safe Transport of Dangerous Cargoes and Related Activities in Port Areas published by the International Maritime Organization, as amended or revised by the Organization from time to time.

section.name: s153
section.heading: Certain freight container to be unpacked immediately after unloading

subsection.leadIn: If a freight container containing S2DG packed together with other goods is unloaded at an approved container terminal, the container terminal operator must unpack the container—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 72 hours from the time the container was unloaded unless the container is loaded onto a connecting vessel at the terminal within the 72-hour period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: within the 96 hours immediately following the 72-hour period mentioned in paragraph (a) if documentary proof is submitted to the Director of Marine during that 96-hour period to prove that—

subparagraph.content: a connecting vessel scheduled to arrive at the terminal within 72 hours from the time the container was unloaded at the terminal fails to arrive within that 72 hours; and
an onward carrying vessel has been arranged to remove the container from the terminal within 7 days after the date on which the container was unloaded at the terminal.

subsection.content: The S2DG unpacked in compliance with subsection (1) must be removed immediately to a licensed store by the container terminal operator.
A container terminal operator who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s154
section.heading: Container terminal operator to maintain record

subsection.content: The container terminal operator of an approved container terminal must maintain a record of S2DG handled in the terminal.

subsection.leadIn: The record must, in relation to each consignment of S2DG handled, contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of receipt of the S2DG;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the class of the S2DG;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the quantity of the S2DG;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the serial number of the freight container containing the S2DG; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date on which the S2DG are moved out of the terminal.

subsection.content: The container terminal operator must, if requested by the Director, produce the record to the Director for inspection.
A container terminal operator who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s155
section.heading: Power of Director to exempt

subsection.content: The Director may, in respect of a specific case or a specific person, grant an exemption from any provision in Parts 3, 4 and 5 and section 154.
An exemption under subsection (1) may be granted subject to the terms and conditions as the Director may specify.

subsection.leadIn: At any time after an exemption has been granted under subsection (1), the Director may, on any ground that the Director considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke the exemption; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vary the terms and conditions specified under subsection (2) for the exemption.

section.name: s156
section.heading: Performance of functions by public officer

subsection.content: The Commissioner may authorize a public officer of the Civil Engineering and Development Department to perform a function of the Commissioner under this Regulation.
The Secretary may authorize a public officer of the Culture, Sports and Tourism Bureau to perform a function of the Secretary under this Regulation. (L.N. 144 of 2022)
The Director may authorize a public officer of the Fire Services Department to perform a function of the Director under this Regulation.
The Director of Marine may authorize a public officer of the Marine Department to perform a function of the Director of Marine under this Regulation.

If a public officer is authorized by an official under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) to perform a function, an act done by the public officer in performing the function is regarded as an act done by the official.
Authorization made under this section must be in writing.
In this section, a reference to the performance of any functions includes the exercise of a power and the discharge of a duty.

section.name: s157
section.heading: Licence and permit: validity period and prescribed fee

subsection.content: A licence or permit granted or renewed under this Regulation is valid for 12 months or a shorter period as may be specified in the licence or permit by the regulating Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Despite sections 3 and 6 of Schedule 8, if a licence or permit is granted or renewed for a period (validity period) of less than 12 months, the fee payable in respect of the grant or renewal is the amount calculated by multiplying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one-twelfth of the fee specified in the Schedule for the grant or renewal of the licence or permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of months (or part of a month) in the validity period.

subsection.content: In calculating a prescribed fee under subsection (2), a fraction of a dollar that is less than 50 cents is disregarded, and a fraction of a dollar that is equal to or more than 50 cents is regarded as a whole dollar.

If the grant of a duplicate or replacement of, or alteration or addition to, or endorsement on, a licence or permit is requested by its licensee or permit holder, the duplicate, replacement, alteration, addition or endorsement may be granted or made by the regulating Authority on payment of the prescribed fees set out in column 4 or 5 of the tables in sections 3 and 6 of Schedule 8.
Subsections (2) and (3) do not apply to items 8 and 9 of the table in section 3 of Schedule 8.
Subsection (4) does not apply to item 8 of the table in section 3 of Schedule 8.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: regulating Authority (規管當局) means—(a)in relation to a licence or permit under Part 2 (other than a permit under section 73)—the Commissioner;(b)in relation to a permit under section 73—the Secretary; or(c)in relation to a licence under Part 3—the Director.

section.name: s158
section.heading: Licence or permit not transferable
section.content: A licence or permit granted or renewed under this Regulation is not transferable.

section.name: s159
section.heading: Special defence for warehouse owner and carrier

subsection.content: This section applies to a warehouse owner or carrier (or a person acting in that capacity) charged with an offence under section 21, 31, 41, 78(3), 79, 80, 81, 87, 102, 109, 110, 116, 122, 123, 130, 131, 134(5) (in so far as it relates to the contravention of subsection (3)), 135, 136, 142, 148, 149, 153 or 154 (defendant).

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for the defendant to establish that the defendant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: did not know the true nature of the contents of the receptacle in relation to which the offence is alleged to have been committed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: could not, with reasonable diligence, have known the true nature of the contents of the receptacle.

subsection.leadIn: The defendant is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the defence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to that matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s160
section.heading: Special defence relating to packing, marking and labelling offence

subsection.content: This section applies to a person charged with an offence under section 142 (defendant).

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for the defendant to establish that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the S2DG is for the defendant’s reasonable personal use and the quantity of the S2DG is sufficient only for that use; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the alleged offence is constituted by the conveyance, or by causing or permitting the conveyance, of S2DG by the defendant—the defendant is conveying, or causing or permitting the conveyance of, the S2DG for the delivery to some other person for the other person’s reasonable personal use and the quantity of the S2DG is sufficient only for that use.

subsection.leadIn: The defendant is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the defence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to that matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s182
section.heading: Contravention of sections 6 and 10 of Ordinance during transitional period

A contravention of section 10 of the Ordinance during the transitional period does not constitute an offence if the act or omission that constitutes the contravention, had it happened before the commencement date, would not have constituted a contravention of that section.

subsection.content: A contravention of section 113, 126 or 127 during the transitional period does not constitute an offence if the act or omission that constitutes the contravention, had it happened before the commencement date, would not have constituted a contravention of any provision of the repealed Cap. 295B.

A contravention of section 131 during the transitional period does not constitute an offence if the act or omission that constitutes the contravention, had it happened before the commencement date, would not have constituted a contravention of regulations 76(a) and 102 of the repealed Cap. 295B.

A contravention of section 142 during the transitional period does not constitute an offence if the act or omission that constitutes the contravention, had it happened before the commencement date, would not have constituted a contravention of regulations 74, 84, 92, 99, 139, 153, 159, 170 and 176 of the repealed Cap. 295B, as may be appropriate.

section.def: suitable (適當), in relation to S1DG packaging, means the packaging is—(a)well constructed so as to prevent any loss of contents from the S1DG package;(b)in good condition;(c)of such a character and construction that any interior surface with which the contents may come into contact is not adversely affected by the contents;(d)capable of withstanding ordinary risks during storage, handling or conveyance; and(e)capable of withstanding any pressure likely to be generated in it in the course of normal use.

section.content: The aggregate explosive content of the total quantity of Class 1 S1DG contained in an S1DG package must not exceed 25 kg.

section.content: Special Class 9 S1DG of different UN numbers must be packed separately.

paragraph.leadIn: designed, made of appropriate material and of a size, so as to be—

section.content: S1DG packaging must not be constructed, whether wholly or partly, of iron or steel unless the iron or steel is covered with such material as to prevent the iron or steel from being or becoming exposed to open air.

section.name: s1

section.name: s2
section.content: S2DG must not be packed together with any other S2DG that is specified as incompatible in the code of practice.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: S2DG packaging must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: designed, made of appropriate material and of a size, so as to be—

subparagraph.content: suitable for the packaging, having regard to the nature of the S2DG contained in it and the capability of withstanding ordinary risks during storage or conveyance; and
able to protect the S2DG against inadvertent or accidental ignition or initiation during storage or conveyance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: maintained in good condition and repair and free from corrosion, contamination or any other defect which may impair its performance.

section.name: s4
section.content: S2DG packaging must be of a size specified in the code of practice, if applicable.

section.name: s5
section.content: S2DG packaging must be filled in conformity with the filling ratio specified in the code of practice, if applicable.

section.name: s6
section.content: S2DG packaging must be filled with S2DG to the extent as to leave within the packaging air space or ullage that is not less than the minimum air space or ullage specified in the code of practice, if applicable.

section.name: s7
section.content: S2DG packaging must be tested according to a method specified in the code of practice, if applicable.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: If S2DG is contained in a pressure receptacle, the receptacle must be one that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is of a type approved for the purposes of section 145(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has passed the inspection or testing for the purposes of section 145(1).

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: S2DG packaging (S2危險品包裝) has the meaning given by section 92.

section.name: s11

section.name: s20
section.content: A label must be displayed in an upright position or a flat position.

section.name: s21
section.leadIn: A label—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be square-shaped, with the minimum length of each side measuring 100 mm (minimum dimensions); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is not feasible to display a label of the minimum dimensions due to the size or shape of the S2DG packaging—must be of reasonable dimensions that are, having regard to the size or shape of the packaging, appropriate for the packaging and must remain clearly visible and legible.

section.name: s22
section.content: If no specific dimensions are indicated for a feature of a label in this Division or in the relevant Figure in Division 2 of this Part, the feature must be in the appropriate scale as shown in the Figure. If a label is of dimensions different from the minimum dimensions, the dimensions of every feature in the label must be adjusted proportionally.

section.name: s23
section.content: The correct textual description in the middle of the label of the S2DG as specified in the code of practice is optional.
